blog.description: Inspired by the amazing @starspangledshitpost, I've decided to follow the adventures of Clint Barton in the comics chronologically, starting at the very beginning. And to document that amazing odyssey on this blog, too, that's kind of the point of the whole thing.

blog.name: parker-peter-please
blog.title: Parker-Peter-Please
blog.description: An absolute Marvel Nut | 16 | female | in love with Tom Holland | https://kat31rules.wixsite.com/teenwritesnbinges

summary:
Chapter Three: There’s No Party Without Richy-rich Jr
Peter Parker entered through the doorway. He hangs his head in shame,...
body:
Ardor 》 Peter Parker Fanfic

Chapter Three: There’s No Party Without Richy-rich Jr

Peter Parker entered through the doorway. He hangs his head in shame, trying to become invisible. Peter didn’t want to be there. Not only that he didn’t like parties, but he was having a difficult enough time already. Harry was keen on cheering him up, and he was always trying to find him a girlfriend. The legendary Harry Osborn called himself the king of wingmen, well, lets just say that he wasn’t. Melissa had seen Peter around school, and assemblies, being the top ranking in their class. Despite how often she had seen him at school, they didn’t hold  a single conversation that lasted more than five minutes. Surprisingly, she had talked with Harry at multiple of the parties she was dragged to. Melissa noticed that Harry was starting to move her way.

“Sup, MVP.” reminding Melissa of his nickname for her. “You partying hard?”

“Harry, if I’m drinking I won’t be able to resist you,“ Melissa teased. A quarter of the time they are together, Harry and Melissa flirt, without any meaning behind it.

“So, are you buddies with Peter over there?”

“Yeah, me and Parker go way back. Don’t you both go to Midtown?”

“Yeah, but it’s a big enough school, I don’t know him very well,” she responded. Liz Allen had found her way back to the two.

“Hey Liz.”

“Hi, Harry.”

”Yo, Parker. Come over here,” Osborn shouted across the room. So, in response, Parker did just that. “Do you know my friends here? They’re from Midtown too,” he asked.

“Yeah, Liz and Melissa was both on the scholastic bowl team last year. School photographer, so I take pictures of a lot of people,” he explained, he secretly had a crush on Liz Allen, so he did know a lot about the girl and her friends.

“Yeah, you’re joining this year, aren’t you?” Liz asked.

“Yeah, I am.”

“Well, welcome to the team then.” Melissa said before Liz could get a word out. It was uncommon how they thinked so much alike.

“Liz! LIZ!” a blond girl shouted.

“Well I guess that’s my cue to go,” she said before parting from the group. “Wait up, I’ll join you,” Harry shouted. He then winked at Peter. Melissa had noticed and rolled her eyes at Harry.

”Your dad works as an factory worker, right?” Peter asked, trying to make some small talk after that awkwardness.

“Yeah, a parts manufacturer for Oscorp.”

“That’s cool. What does your mom do?”

“Um… My mom died two years ago, then we moved here.” Melissa answered, looking down at her shoes.

“Shit. I’m sorry.”

“It’s fine, I’m sorry about your uncle. I know what you’re going through. I’m here, if you ever need someone to talk to.”

“Did you see the big MIT speech?” he added, trying to change the conversation.

“No, I must have missed it.”

“Oh, weren’t you in the hospital? I thought I heard something like that from classmates.”

“Yeah, the rumors are true.” she said, not knowing if she was even telling the truth.

“How are you feeling? Being in a hospital for an entire month must have sucked.”

She shrugged, “It’s all fuzzy, but that’s nothing compared to losing a guardian, I should be the one asking how you are doing.”

Stumbling, Liz had found her way back to Melissa. “Mel, I think I’m gonna be sick. I don’t feel good.”

“I have to take care of her,” Melissa explained tp Peter as she led her friend to the bathroom. Melissa sat her down in front of the toilet just in time. Liz had started to vomit,  which wasn’t a pretty sight.

“I hate this. I hate that everyone thinks I’m perfect. I’m obviously not.”

“Liz, hey! Listen to me, no one is perfect. Ok, and you’re pretty damn close.”

“Easy for you to say. You Are perfect.” This hit Melissa in the gut. She was far from perfect, and she lived a pretty crappy life. She just summed up to the beer she was drinking.

“Liz, you don’t mean that, you’re drunk. You’re in a bad place right now, ok? Your boyfriend just broke up with you.”

“mmmh…” she moaned, and then like that, Liz was out.

“Hey, you gotta stay awake, so I can get you to the car.” Half awake, Liz had leaned against Melissa. She kept Liz upright and they stumbled their way out of the bathroom. She bumped into Peter on the way out.

“I gotta take her home.”

“Ok, do you need me to call a cab?”

“No, she brought her car. I have my license, so I can drive her home.”

“How are you supposed to get home?”

I’ll just stay with her tonight, make sure she doesn’t do anything she’ll regret.

“Well, I can at least help you get her out to the car.”

“Ok.” Peter grabbed her free arm and hoisted it over his shoulder like Melissa had done.

“Mel, you smell pretty,” Liz blurted out. Melissa chuckled in response. They had finally made their way out to the car. Melissa buckled her in the passenger seat.

“Thanks for the help. Do you want a ride home?”

“No, thanks. I don’t live far from here.” He lied, he knew he would take them out of the way.

“You sure? I got plenty of room.”

“Yeah, I’ll be fine.” the truth was that he had walked farther than this before.

“Alright, suit yourself. I’ll see you around nerd,” Vano teased.

“Y-Yeah, goodnight Vano,” Parker stuttered.  Melissa started the car, and put it in drive. She started to drive off. At the next stop sign she sent a text to her father. Spending the night at Liz’s. She didn’t expect a reply anytime soon. She sat the phone back in cup holder and stepped on the gas.

She looked at the road, she was focused, a little too focused. She didn’t notice the car pulling out of the driveway. She slammed on the breaks, as a vision popped up in her head.

She saw a car crash, and she felt a cold surface and needles in her arms.

Luckily, she didn’t hit the car, or wake Liz Allen. This is why she didn’t like to drive, too much could go wrong. She didn’t really worry about it though, not a lot of kids could afford cars, especially her and her dad. She backed up to let the car out and then went on her way. She had made it to Liz’s house without anymore conflicts.

Liz’s parents were out of town, so she didn’t have to worry about Liz getting in trouble. She grabbed the key hidden behind a loose brick, opened the door, and put it back. She led Liz to the couch. Now, conscious and starting to mutter.

“I’m sorry, Mel. I’m a mess. You’re too good to me. Thank you. You take care of everyone else. I wish you didn’t always have to.” Melissa didn’t know what to reply, secretly she wished she didn’t have to take care of everyone too, but it was in her nature, she cared for them, and oftentimes if she didn’t, then no one else would.

“Try to get some rest, Liz,” she replied covering her with a blanket. And sat in the chair across from her.

———–

Despite how often she had seen him at school, they didn’t hold  a single conversation that lasted more than five minutes. Surprisingly, she had talked with Harry at multiple of the parties she was dragged to. Melissa noticed that Harry was starting to move her way.

“Sup, MVP.” reminding Melissa of his nickname for her. “You partying hard?”

“Harry, if I’m drinking I won’t be able to resist you,“ Melissa teased. A quarter of the time they are together, Harry and Melissa flirt, without any meaning behind it.

“So, are you buddies with Peter over there?”

“Yeah, me and Parker go way back. Don’t you both go to Midtown?”

“Yeah, but it’s a big enough school, I don’t know him very well,” she responded. Liz Allen had found her way back to the two.

“Hey Liz.”

“Hi, Harry.”

”Yo, Parker. Come over here,” Osborn shouted across the room. So, in response, Parker did just that. “Do you know my friends here? They’re from Midtown too,” he asked.

“Yeah, Liz and Melissa was both on the scholastic bowl team last year. School photographer, so I take pictures of a lot of people,” he explained, he secretly had a crush on Liz Allen, so he did know a lot about the girl and her friends.

“Yeah, you’re joining this year, aren’t you?” Liz asked.

“Yeah, I am.”

“Well, welcome to the team then.” Melissa said before Liz could get a word out. It was uncommon how they thinked so much alike.

“Liz! LIZ!” a blond girl shouted.

“Well I guess that’s my cue to go,” she said before parting from the group. “Wait up, I’ll join you,” Harry shouted. He then winked at Peter. Melissa had noticed and rolled her eyes at Harry.

”Your dad works as an factory worker, right?” Peter asked, trying to make some small talk after that awkwardness.

“Yeah, a parts manufacturer for Oscorp.”

“That’s cool. What does your mom do?”

“Um… My mom died two years ago, then we moved here.” Melissa answered, looking down at her shoes.

“Shit. I’m sorry.”

“It’s fine, I’m sorry about your uncle. I know what you’re going through. I’m here, if you ever need someone to talk to.”

“Did you see the big MIT speech?” he added, trying to change the conversation.

“No, I must have missed it.”

“Oh, weren’t you in the hospital? I thought I heard something like that from classmates.”

“Yeah, the rumors are true.” she said, not knowing if she was even telling the truth.

“How are you feeling? Being in a hospital for an entire month must have sucked.”

She shrugged, “It’s all fuzzy, but that’s nothing compared to losing a guardian, I should be the one asking how you are doing.”

Stumbling, Liz had found her way back to Melissa. “Mel, I think I’m gonna be sick. I don’t feel good.”

“I have to take care of her,” Melissa explained tp Peter as she led her friend to the bathroom. Melissa sat her down in front of the toilet just in time. Liz had started to vomit,  which wasn’t a pretty sight.

“I hate this. I hate that everyone thinks I’m perfect. I’m obviously not.”

“Liz, hey! Listen to me, no one is perfect. Ok, and you’re pretty damn close.”

“Easy for you to say. You Are perfect.” This hit Melissa in the gut. She was far from perfect, and she lived a pretty crappy life. She just summed up to the beer she was drinking.

“Liz, you don’t mean that, you’re drunk. You’re in a bad place right now, ok? Your boyfriend just broke up with you.”

“mmmh…” she moaned, and then like that, Liz was out.

“Hey, you gotta stay awake, so I can get you to the car.” Half awake, Liz had leaned against Melissa. She kept Liz upright and they stumbled their way out of the bathroom. She bumped into Peter on the way out.

“I gotta take her home.”

“Ok, do you need me to call a cab?”

“No, she brought her car. I have my license, so I can drive her home.”

“How are you supposed to get home?”

I’ll just stay with her tonight, make sure she doesn’t do anything she’ll regret.

“Well, I can at least help you get her out to the car.”

“Ok.” Peter grabbed her free arm and hoisted it over his shoulder like Melissa had done.

“Mel, you smell pretty,” Liz blurted out. Melissa chuckled in response. They had finally made their way out to the car. Melissa buckled her in the passenger seat.

“Thanks for the help. Do you want a ride home?”

“No, thanks. I don’t live far from here.” He lied, he knew he would take them out of the way.

“You sure? I got plenty of room.”

“Yeah, I’ll be fine.” the truth was that he had walked farther than this before.

“Alright, suit yourself. I’ll see you around nerd,” Vano teased.

“Y-Yeah, goodnight Vano,” Parker stuttered.  Melissa started the car, and put it in drive. She started to drive off. At the next stop sign she sent a text to her father. Spending the night at Liz’s. She didn’t expect a reply anytime soon. She sat the phone back in cup holder and stepped on the gas.

She looked at the road, she was focused, a little too focused. She didn’t notice the car pulling out of the driveway. She slammed on the breaks, as a vision popped up in her head.

She saw a car crash, and she felt a cold surface and needles in her arms.

Luckily, she didn’t hit the car, or wake Liz Allen. This is why she didn’t like to drive, too much could go wrong. She didn’t really worry about it though, not a lot of kids could afford cars, especially her and her dad. She backed up to let the car out and then went on her way. She had made it to Liz’s house without anymore conflicts.

Liz’s parents were out of town, so she didn’t have to worry about Liz getting in trouble. She grabbed the key hidden behind a loose brick, opened the door, and put it back. She led Liz to the couch. Now, conscious and starting to mutter.

“I’m sorry, Mel. I’m a mess. You’re too good to me. Thank you. You take care of everyone else. I wish you didn’t always have to.” Melissa didn’t know what to reply, secretly she wished she didn’t have to take care of everyone too, but it was in her nature, she cared for them, and oftentimes if she didn’t, then no one else would.

“Try to get some rest, Liz,” she replied covering her with a blanket. And sat in the chair across from her.

———–

blog.name: thevideonastiest
blog.title: The Willem Dafoe and Other Appreciation Society
blog.description: Hi i'm Chloe! This blog is mostly for things like crushes and self-insert things, so come down and don't be shy! 😁It can get lewd here, so 18+!

summary: Norman and Chloe, how they surprise each other
question: Norman and Chloe, how they surprise each other
answer:
Ahhhh thank you! 😊

gif link

I’ve not done one of these in a bit tbh, so i’m not sure how to write them since it’s an OC … but me? 🤔 So, third person, it’s easier!

As friends, Chloe would surprise Norman by finding out his favourite treat and when he’s feeling pretty stressed out, just happening to bake it for her monthly bake and bringing him in a portion or maybe two. And hell, even her natural displays of affection like a comforting hand squeeze (or much later on and in private, hugs) surprise poor Norman as he’s quite touch starved. In return as Norman warms to her, he’ll sometimes surprise her with something like say, listening to her asking about if she can put flowers on her desk for Valentines, and on the day there’s a big bouquet of roses in a vase on her desk suddenly. Which almost seems like … flirting. 🤔

Later on as the relationship blooms, Norman starts to try and surprise and show affection the way he feels most comfortable; buying expensive gifts like jewellery and clothes. Which Chloe appreciates, but makes her feel more uncomfortable since she both feels guilty having the money spent on her and her noticing that Norman seems to do this as part of some self-esteem problem, like he feels gifts and money are the way to get a partner to stay. So she makes sure to let him know she likes the gifts, but loves his heart and brain. And over time, it sinks in more for Norman and he surprises in more subtle ways like setting up some music on the old record player in his study to dance with her, or using his Goblin strength to pick her up and twirl her, knowing it makes her giggle like mad every time.

Chloe ironically likes to buy Norman quite a few gifts too when she can, to make sure he knows that it’s not his money she cares about. Things that are smaller but meaningful, like a book on masks and their place in their culture and symbolism, or chemistry themed drinking glasses, or mugs with awful science puns on that make Norman sigh and groan … but he drinks from still. 😆Apart from gifts, she loves most to surprise him with sudden kisses and new baked goods recipes and sometimes sexy lingerie and new … toys. 😏

That came out so long ah man.

reblog.comment:
Ahhhh thank you! 😊

gif link

summary: I just watched Spider-Verse and it was amazing!! It’s such a beautiful movie!!
body:
I just watched Spider-Verse and it was amazing!! It’s such a beautiful movie!!

And now I really want to try to make myself a spider-sona! I can’t draw bodies properly yet, but I can draw heads! And I can try to draw a body!

blog.name: rabbitdragonmystery
blog.title: Being alive is pretty much a constant stream of embarrassment

summary: Today I found out my friend didn’t know Uncle Ben died in like every Spider-man origin ever.  Like she knew the words “With...
body:
Today I found out my friend didn’t know Uncle Ben died in like every Spider-man origin ever. 

Like she knew the words “With great power comes great responsibility” and that Spider-man was a guy from Queens named Peter Parker, and that he was bitten by a radioactive spider, but somehow, that one bit of pop culture just slipped under her radar.
